subject: omx: Fix a missing g_free() in error path
commitMessage:
omx: Fix a missing g_free() in error path

This fixes a memory leak with g_strdup() when an error occurs.

https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=731141

Change-Id: I333df2cc1197e2c04ca65f2f82889e9ce7c975d2
Signed-off-by: Kazunori Kobayashi <kkobayas@igel.co.jp>

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.

Patch Set 1:

Hi all,

This patch, which is merged in the upstream, is to avoid the memory leak issue.
Is it any plan to update this repository to the latest version?
Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Patch Set 1:

Any chance to get this merged?
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2
Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased
Patch Set 2: Verified+1
Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

Patch Set 3:

The tag submit/tizen_ivi_genivi/20140214.004350 was pushed, but it was not completed because of the following reason(s):

- The tag means you want to submit commit ea32de02b783e18bbce7d14d4f3a7d583ce2f612 in tizen_ivi_genivi branch to OBS, but this commit does NOT exist in tizen_ivi_genivi branch. Please use correct branch name as version in tag name submit/{version}/{date.time}.

Suggest to use "gbs submit" to trigger submission, or use following command to create tag "git tag submit/${version}/$(date --utc +%%Y%%m%%d.%%H%%M%%S) -m "****" ".
